name: Game Element
rule: A game element is any physical component of the game, a story passage, or a note the game instructed you to take.

name: Generic Tokens
rule: Use Generic tokens to keep track of anything that you want to; these were added for your convenience. Whenever there’s an effect that doesn’t use any of the specific tokens, you will be instructed to use a generic token to track it.

name: Random
rule: When you are asked to choose a random element, do the following based on the element:

name: Random Card
rule: Draw the top card from the indicated (facedown) deck.

name: Random Direction
rule: Draw the top card from the Minor Trauma deck. The arrow in the bottom left corner designates the randomly chosen direction. If it shows a rotating arrow, you may instead choose a direction. Place the drawn card at the bottom of the deck.

name: Random Element
rule: Roll one d10 for each element, lowest roll is selected.

name: Ignore
rule: “Ignored” elements or rules are not resolved. “Ignore” can be specific instances (accompanied by the word “this”) or constant.

name: Remove
rule: “Removed” elements are set aside and not used until instructed, or until the end of Battle if not.

name: Disable
rule: “Disabled” elements or rules are ignored until stated, or until the end of Battle if not.

name: Discard
rule: “Discarded” elements are Disabled and Removed.

name: Cannot
rule: The term “cannot” is absolute. It cannot be overridden unless explicitly instructed.

name: Gain
rule: Whenever you gain a game element, simply find it and add it to an appropriate place

name: Gaining Gear
rule: Gained Gear cards are added to the Argo Armory deck.

name: Gaining Gear in Battle
rule: If you gain a Gear card during a Battle, the Titan responsible for the gain may immediately equip that card. If the gained card has the Possession keyword, the Titan or Argonaut must immediately equip it.

name: Gaining Tech
rule: Gained Technology cards are added to the Technology deck.

name: Gaining Clues
rule: Gained Clue and Ally cards are placed next to your current Story and Doom cards.

name: Gaining Mnemos cards
rule: Gained Mnemos cards are placed in the play area of the Argonaut who gained them. If it is impossible for any Argonaut to gain a Mnemos card (III.5.5), instead add it to the Mnemos Vault (III.5.6).

name: Gaining Tokens
rule: Gained tokens are placed in the appropriate area.

name: Gaining Battle Tokens
rule: Tokens that have no effect outside of Battle (e.g. Ambrosia or Despair) are held by the Argonaut who gained them.

name: Gaining Other Game Elements
rule: Some game elements are not represented by physical components. If you gain any element that is not represented by a component, note it on either the Argo Sheet or an Argonaut Sheet, whichever is specified.

name: Loss
rule: When you lose a physical component, archive it unless instructed otherwise. When you lose a game element that is not represented by a physical component, erase it from the appropriate sheet (if it is singular) or lower its value by a specified number.

name: Gain/Loss Mitigation
rule: Some Technology abilities may allow you to ignore gaining or losing a specific game element (VIII.6.4.2d).

name: Voluntary Gain/Loss
rule: If the gain/loss is listed in the text of an active ability, story choice (IX.1.3), or any other non-forced effect, it is considered voluntary (a “payment”).

name: Unmitigable Loss
rule: Voluntary gain/loss cannot be mitigated or ignored in any way.

name: Gaining/Losing as a Group
rule: When you are instructed to “gain as a group” or “lose as a group", distribute the specified statistic or element among all of the Argonauts as you see fit; it does not have to be distributed evenly.

name: Archiving (Permanently Removing)
rule: When instructed to Permanently Remove a game element (or Archive it), place it back in the game box. It is no longer considered a part of the game state (though an effect may instruct you to return it).

name: Voluntary/Involuntary
rule: “Voluntary” effects are those which the Titan/Primordial has done with its own action/effect. “Involuntary” effects are any effects which a Titan/Primordial resolves but are not caused by itself.

name: Exhaust
rule: When instructed to exhaust a game element or ability, turn it 90 degrees or place a Generic Token on it to denote this. Cards remain exhausted until they are unexhausted by another effect.

name: Gameplay Flow
rule: This game is played over many sessions. During a game session, you will likely play a few Campaign Rounds. Each Campaign Round is made up of a series of Steps. Each of these Steps incorporates one or more of the game’s Phases: Voyage Phase, Adventure Phase, or Battle Phase.

name: Gameplay Round
rule: A Campaign Round is one in-game day on the Timeline.

name: Steps
rule: Steps make up the structure of a Campaign Round and are always resolved in a fixed order.

name: Phases
rule: Phases are gameplay segments that differentiate which rules are in effect at any moment.

name: Phase Types
rule: There are three different Phases in ATO: Voyage, Battle, and Adventure.

name: Phase Rule of Thumb
rule: You are always in a game Phase. If you’re not in the Adventure Phase or the Battle Phase, you’re in the Voyage Phase.

name: Phase Entering
rule: When you are in a Battle, you are in the Battle Phase. When you are reading passages in the Storybook, you’re in the Adventure Phase. Always return to the Voyage Phase after finishing a Battle or Story section.

name: Phase Campaign Round
rule: Any Campaign Round Step can consist of any combination of Phases.

name: Campaign Round Sequence
rule: Each Campaign Round, you will go through the Campaign Round Steps (VIII.1-10), resolving them in order.

name: Events
rule: All Campaign Round Steps always happen, but there are not always events during a Step in a given Campaign Round. Steps VIII.1-3 always have events.

name: Always Move
rule: During the Movement Step, you must move the Argo to an adjacent Map tile.

name: Map Arrows
rule: You must choose a direction from the arrows on your tile. You cannot move in a direction without arrows. If there is more than one arrow in the same direction, you must pick one before revealing the new tile, the tile in that direction will be Sectored.

name: Factions on Map Arrows
rule: Faction symbols on Map Arrows tell you which Faction(s) are on the Map tiles your current tile connects to.

name: Map Arrows Lock Symbols
rule: If a map arrow has a padlock symbol on it, ignore that arrow unless you have the required Technology.

name: River Lock Symbol
rule: (Cycle 1 only) Ignore Map Arrows with this symbol unless you have the XXX Technology card.

name: First Cataract Lock Symbol
rule: (Cycle 2 only) Ignore Map Arrows with this symbol unless you have the XXX Technology card.

name: One-Way Canals Lock Symbol
rule: (Cycle 2 only) These Map Arrow symbols represent directions in which you are free to move one way, but are Locked from the other.

name: Second Cataract Lock Symbol
rule: (Cycle 2 only) Ignore Map Arrows with this symbol unless you have the XXX Technology card.

name: Sluice Gate Lock Symbol
rule: (Cycle 2 only) Ignore Map Arrows with this symbol unless you have the XXX Technology card.

name: Placing Map Tiles
rule: If the tile you’re moving to isn’t revealed, find the Map tile with the number of the arrow selected on its back and place it adjacent to the Map tile you are traveling from, so that the directional arrows on the shared border of the two tiles align. Make sure to orient the new tile in the same way as all of the other tiles. Place a reminder token of some sort on the tile to mark it as Unexplored.

name: Ambrosia Limit X/+X
rule: Your Ambrosia Limit becomes X or is increased by X, respectively. If you have more than one instance of the former, then the one with the greatest X is used (before applying modifiers).

name: Armor-Piercing
rule: During the Power Roll, ignore Hardened.

name: Armor Reroll X
rule: During the Armor Roll step of a Primordial Attack Sequence, you may reroll up to X Armor dice.

name: Ascended
rule: This Gear ignores Power Level penalties.

name: Assist X
rule: During another Titan’s Power Roll, if, after applying all bonuses, their total Power is less than the AT value and you are within your weapon’s range, you may gain 1 Rage and a Combat Fatigue to immediately add X Break tokens to the Kratos Pool. This ability can only be used if it allows the Attacker to Wound.

name: Attack Reroll X
rule: During an Attack Roll, you may re-roll up to X Attack dice with no cost.

name: Auto-Black X
rule: During the first ability window, place X Black tokens (X.1.9.6) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Auto-Break X
rule: During the first ability window, place X Break tokens (X.1.9.1) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Awakening Lock
rule: You cannot Awaken.

name: Black X
rule: During the second ability window, place X Black tokens (X.1.9.6) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Bleeding X
rule: Gain the Bleeding Condition card (unless you already have it) and place X Bleeding tokens on it.

name: Bleeding Limit X/+X
rule: Your Bleeding Limit becomes X or is increased by X, respectively. If you have more than one instance of the former, then the one with the greatest X is used (before applying modifiers).

name: Block X
rule: After counting hits from an Evasion Roll, subtract X hits.

name: Break X
rule: During the second ability window, place X Break tokens (X.1.9.1) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Burden X
rule: During the First or Second Ability Window, take X Condition, Despair, or Ambrosia tokens from the nearest Titan. (This does not count as gaining those tokens.)

name: Burn
rule: Gain 1 Danger for each Metal Gear card you have equipped and discard all Flammable Gear cards. If this is part of a Primordial Attack Sequence, add the Danger gained to the Danger gained from hits.

name: Bypass
rule: You may move through other Titans. You cannot end your voluntary movement on a space occupied by another Titan.

name: Carving X
rule: When you wound the Primordial, test Wisdom (8+). On a success, you immediately gain X additional non-Core Primordial resources from that BP card. These resources are not multiplied by the Primordial level.

name: Clutch
rule: During the Power Roll step, if, after applying bonuses, you have less total Power than the AT value by exactly 1, you may gain 1 Power. After you finish resolving this Attack Sequence, discard your active weapon.

name: Combo-Breaker: X spaces
rule: If you are not the Priority Target, you may move X spaces and exhaust a Gear card with a Weapon Trait matching the current space on the Combo Track to break the Combo. This ability is not stackable.

name: Self Combo-Breaker: X spaces
rule: Identical to Combo-Breaker, but you can only use the Gear card which this ability is on to break the Combo (you do not have to exhaust an additional card). This Gear must still possess a matching Weapon Trait.

name: Commit
rule: When this weapon becomes your active weapon (X.5.1), gain 1 Fate.

name: Consumed
rule: Treat “consumed” as an Instant Death effect.

name: Crash
rule: Gain 1 Danger. Knockdown.

name: Cumbersome
rule: During the second ability window, if you successfully wounded with this weapon, exhaust it. Treat this as a voluntary exhaust.

name: Daze
rule: During the first ability window, if you are adjacent to the Primordial, you may turn the Primordial so that you are in a Rear space.

name: Deadly
rule: During an Attack Roll, replace one of your regular Attack dice with an additional Crit die. If you roll only one Attack die, you gain a Crit Chance on a natural 9–10 result instead.

name: Death X
rule: Gain the Death Condition card (unless you already have it) and place X Condition tokens on it. If you already have the Death Condition card and X is lower than the number of Condition tokens you have, discard Condition tokens until you X matches.

name: Displace
rule: Move to an empty space adjacent to its current position. If a Titan is displaced and there is no space it can be legally displaced to, it dies instead.

name: Diversion
rule: During the second ability window, place a Diversion token (X.1.9.3) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Dodge
rule: When you are about to resolve an Evasion Roll, gain +1 Evasion for this roll.

name: Doomed
rule: During this effect, dice cannot be re-rolled using Fate.

name: Elation X
rule: During the second ability window, you may discard X Despair tokens or Ambrosia tokens to place X Opening tokens in the Kratos Pool (X.1.9.2).

name: Escalate X
rule: Escalate X times (X.5.10.6). Do not look at the removed cards.

name: Evolving
rule: When you equip a Gear card with this keyword, write the Gear’s name on your Argonaut sheet in the Mnemos section. The Gear instructs you on what you need to do to evolve it. Track your progress on doing so by marking nodes on the Mnemos track. If this Gear card is equipped by another Argonaut, continue keeping track on the original sheet. If the Argonaut the original sheet belongs to dies, transfer the progress to another living Argonaut’s sheet. If you permanently lose the Gear card, erase it from the sheet; you lose all evolution progress on it.

name: Fate Armor
rule: This card’s Armor Dice may also be used to mitigate Fate dealt by Primordial Attacks. If you are dealt Fate and Danger, you may distribute the mitigation between the two.

name: Fire X
rule: During the second ability window, place X Fire tokens (X.1.9.4) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Frontlines
rule: If your Titan is dead, at the End of Battle roll a d10. On a ‘1’, your Argonaut dies as well.

name: Glaciate
rule: To Glaciate a space, place a Black Iceberg Terrain tile there.

name: Giant Glaciate
rule: To Giant Glaciate a space, place a Giant Black Iceberg Terrain tile there.

name: Greater Pass X
rule: During the Clear the Kratos Pool step, choose up to X Kratos tokens to remain in the pool.

name: Hardened
rule: A BP card with this keyword has +2 AT. Ignore this ability if you have a Crit Chance.

name: Heal
rule: Take the top card from the Wound Stack and remove it from the Battle. It does not provide resources at the end of the Battle.

name: Heartseeker
rule: During the Draw BP card step of a Titan Attack Sequence (X.5.6), you may look at the top two BP cards and choose which one to attack. Shuffle the other card back into the deck.

name: Hide
rule: If you are not in front of the Primordial, you may activate this ability at the end of your turn to become Hidden. If you have the Priority Target token, pass it to the Titan with the highest Rage other than you.

name: Hidden
rule: As long as you are Hidden, you have +1 Evasion and +1 Precision. You stop being Hidden if you move in front of the Primordial, gain the Priority Target token, after the second ability window of your Attack, or at the end of your next turn. (Place a generic token on the game element granting you Hide as a reminder.)

name: Hope X
rule: During the second ability window, place X Hope tokens (X.1.9.7) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Incinerated
rule: Treat “incinerated” as an Instant Death effect.

name: Inspire X
rule: During the first ability window, choose up to X Knocked Down Titans, they may immediately stand up.

name: Jump
rule: At the start of movement, you may activate this ability to ignore up to 1 space of a Terrain tile.

name: Advanced Jump
rule: Ignore up to 2 spaces instead.

name: Knockback X
rule: Move the affected miniature X spaces directly away from the source of Knockback in a straight line (or in a specific direction if specified).

name: Knockback From Attacks
rule: If Knockback is caused by a Primordial Attack, it affects the Target(s) only if the Target(s) are within the Attack’s range.

name: Knockback From Responses
rule: If Knockback is caused by a Primordial Response, it affects the Attacker only if they are within adjacency.

name: Knocked Back Titans
rule: Knocked back Titans ignore all Terrain tiles they move through except Obstacles. If a Titan would be forced to move through a Destructible Obstacle Terrain tile, stop its movement, remove the Terrain tile from the Battle Board and place the Titan in its space, then the Titan suffers Crash. If a Titan would be forced to move through an Indestructible Obstacle, it stops on an adjacent space right before the Obstacle, then suffers Crash.

name: Knocked Back Primordials
rule: Knocked Back Primordials can move through any Terrain tiles and miniatures without hindrance. They destroy any Terrain tiles (except Indestructible) they move through and cause Crash and Unavoidable Knockback to Titans as normal.

name: Knockback Into Board Edge
rule: If the affected miniature is Knocked Back into a Board Edge, it continues to move along the edge, if possible, away from the source of Knockback.

name: Knockdown
rule: Gain the Knockdown Condition card, “Falling down” side up, and tip your miniature on its side. Follow the rules of the Condition card.

name: Knockback From Attacks
rule: If Knockdown is caused by an Attack, it affects the Target only if it is within the Attack’s range.

name: Knockback From Responses
rule: If Knockdown is caused by a Response, it affects the Attacker only if they are within adjacency.

name: Laser Resistance X
rule: Each Laser Attack hit deals X less Danger to you. In Cycle IV+, this loses its Keyword status and becomes a Defensive Statistic instead.

name: Lifeline
rule: When you are about to die from a Chasm space, Displace instead. Alternatively, when you are about to die from falling from a Boundless Board Edge, stop adjacent to it. This ability can be used even if Knocked Down or otherwise prohibited from using active abilities.

name: Lumbering
rule: Cannot be involuntarily moved.

name: Masterwork
rule: During an Attack Roll, you may reroll 1s with no cost.

name: Midas Immune
rule: ?, no effect yet

name: Motivate X
rule: During the second ability window, choose another Titan. That Titan may move up to X spaces. (Reminder: If you gain multiple instances of a Keyword, they do not have to stack and can therefore be resolved separately.)

name: Opening X
rule: During the second ability window, place X Opening tokens in the Kratos Pool (X.1.9.2).

name: Overbreak X
rule: During the second ability window, if your Total Power exceeds the AT value by at least 1, place X Break tokens in the Kratos Pool (X.1.9.1).

name: Pass X
rule: During the Clear the Kratos Pool step, choose up to X Opening and/or Break tokens to remain in the Kratos Pool.

name: Perishable
rule: After you finish resolving a Titan Attack Sequence with this weapon, discard it.

name: Precise
rule: During the Draw a BP card step (X.5.6), after drawing the card you may choose to draw the top card of the BP discard instead. If you do, place the first drawn card back into the BP deck and shuffle it.

name: Provoke
rule: During the first ability window, gain the Priority Target token and turn the Primordial to face you.

name: Power Reroll X
rule: During the Power Roll step of an Attack, you may re-roll up to X Power dice.

name: Pull X
rule: Move the affected miniature X spaces towards the source of the Pull, along the shortest possible path.

name: Pull over other Miniatures
rule: The affected miniature can move through spaces occupied by other miniatures.

name: Pull over Terrain
rule: The affected miniature must resolve the effects of any Terrain tiles it moves through.

name: Pull over Destructible Obstacles
rule: If a Titan is about to be pulled into a Destructible Obstacle (e.g. a Column), remove the Terrain tile from the Battle Board, the Titan suffers Crash, then continue the Pull.

name: Pull Over Indestructible Obstacles
rule: If a Titan is about to be pulled into an Indestructible Obstacle, it suffers Crash and continues to move along the Obstacle’s edge along the shortest possible path towards the Primordial.

name: Adjacency
rule: If the affected miniature is or becomes adjacent to the source, the Pull does not end. Instead, move the source directly away from the affected miniature the remaining number of spaces, then finish the Pull. The source’s movement is voluntary, the affected miniature’s movement is involuntary.

name: Titan Timing
rule: Titans may use the Pull X keyword during either the first or second ability window.

name: Pushback X
rule: Turn the source towards the affected miniature. Then, move X spaces in the direction of the affected miniature, pushing it in a straight line.

name: Pushback over other Miniatures
rule: Pushed Titans can move through spaces occupied by other miniatures. If a Titan ends involuntary movement on a space with another miniature, the other miniature is Displaced.

name: Pushback over Terrain
rule: The affected miniature must resolve the effects of any Terrain tiles it moves through.

name: Pushback if not Adjacent
rule: If the affected miniature is not adjacent, move the source in its direction along the shortest possible path.

name: Pushback over Destructible Obstacles
rule: If a Titan is about to be pushed into a Destructible Obstacle, remove that Terrain tile from the Battle Board, the Titan suffers Crash, then continue Pushback.

name: Pushback over Indestructible Obstacles
rule: If a Titan is about to be pushed into an Indestructible Obstacle, displace it to an adjacent space that would allow the Primordial to continue movement onto a space previously occupied by the Titan, then continue Pushback. If the Titan dies from displacement, then once the Primordial has moved into the space formerly occupied by the Titan, the Pushback stops.

name: Pushback over Board Edge
rule: If a Titan or Primordial is about to be pushed into the Board Edge, it is displaced to an adjacent space in a way that would allow the source of Pushback to move onto a space previously occupied by the affected miniature, then continue Pushback.

name: Pushback and Titan Timing
rule: Titans may resolve the Pushback X keyword during either the first or second ability window of their Attack or when specifically instructed to resolve it immediately.

name: Quantum
rule: For the purposes of Rapid Adaptation, if attacking from the Blindspot, your weapon can have any Weapon Trait

name: Ranged Y–X
rule: To attack with this weapon, you must be at least Y and up to X spaces away from your target. This keyword is not stackable.

name: Reach X
rule: You may attack from up to X spaces away. This keyword is not stackable.

name: Reflex
rule: Move up to 1 space.

name: Advanced Reflex
rule: Move up to 2 spaces.

name: Superior Reflex
rule: Move up to 3 spaces.

name: Reposition X
rule: During the second ability window, you may move up to X spaces.

name: Reinforce X
rule: When you are about to resolve an Armor Roll, add X red dice to your Armor dice pool.

name: Advanced Reinforce X
rule: When you are about to resolve an Armor Roll, add X black dice to your Armor dice pool.

name: Superior Reinforce X
rule: When you are about to resolve an Armor Roll, add X white dice to your Armor dice pool.

name: Rewind
rule: Place your Titan on your Time Anchor. If your Time Anchor is not on the Board, you are erased from existence instead.

name: Rocksteady
rule: When you are about to suffer Knockdown, you may use this ability to ignore it.

name: Rouse X
rule: During the second ability window, place X Rouse tokens (X.1.9.6) in the Kratos Pool.

name: Rollout
rule: When you are about to suffer Knockdown while adjacent to the Primordial, suffer Knockback 4 instead.

name: Rush
rule: Move with +1 Speed and perform a Melee/Reach Attack with Auto-break 1. You must move at least 3 spaces and reach your target via the shortest possible path.

name: Improved Rush
rule: Move with +2 Speed and perform a Melee/Reach Attack with Auto-break 1 and +1 Precision. You must move at least 3 spaces and reach your target via the shortest possible path.

name: Sacrifice
rule: During the first ability window, you may gain 1 Danger to place one Break token in the Kratos Pool (X.1.9.1).

name: Scale
rule: When you are about to perform a test to climb a Vantage Point or Elevated Terrain, automatically succeed at that test instead.

name: Second Chance
rule: After you draw a Trauma or Obol card, you may ignore its effect and discard it. Draw and resolve another card from the same deck (note: a discarded Obol is immediately shuffled back into the Obol deck). You cannot ignore the second draw in any way. This ability can be used even when knocked down or otherwise prohibited from using active abilities.

name: Shaded
rule: Until the start of the next Titan Round, treat your Titan as being on as shaded space.

name: Solace
rule: Discard a Mind Condition card or a Despair token from yourself or an adjacent Titan.

name: Spiral X
rule: During the Attack Roll step, you may reroll up to X hits to lose 1 Fate for each. If you reroll a Crit die this way, the original result does not grant you a Crit Chance.

name: Spotlight
rule: During the first ability window, if you have the Priority Target token, gain 1 Red Power Die for this Attack.

name: Stalwart
rule: When you are about to suffer Knockback, you may use this ability to ignore it.

name: Succor
rule: During another Titan’s Power Roll, if, after applying all bonuses, they have less total Power than the AT value by exactly 1 and you are within your weapon range of the Primordial, you may gain 1 Rage, a Combat Fatigue, and discard your active weapon to add 1 Power to that Power Roll.

name: Suppress
rule: Shuffle the discard pile denoted by the subtype into the appropriate deck.

name: BP Suppress
rule: Shuffle the BP discard pile into the BP deck.

name: AI Suppress
rule: Shuffle the AI discard pile into the AI deck.

name: Temporal  Reflex
rule: When you are about to suffer Crash, ignore it. If you would suffer Unavoidable Knockback, displace instead.

name: Time-Clocked
rule: Gain the Time-Clocked Condition card, Departing side up and remove your miniature from the board. Follow the rules of the Condition card.

name: Tireless
rule: When you are about to activate the Cumbersome keyword, you may ignore it.

name: Titan Possession
rule: Once you equip this Gear card on a Titan, you have to equip it on this Titan for every subsequent Battle. You may, however, junction this Titan with a different Argonaut.

name: Argonaut Possession
rule: Once you equip this Gear card on an Argonaut, you have to equip it on that Argonaut’s Titan for every subsequent Battle.

name: Transform
rule: Use this ability to flip this Gear card to the other side. This is always an active ability.

name: Trick
rule: Weapons with the Transform keyword and Trick may immediately flip to the other side when you meet the Trick condition.

name: Trauma Trick
rule: You may immediately flip this card after you resolve a Trauma card.

name: Wound Trick
rule: You may immediately flip this card after you Wound.

name: Fail Trick
rule: You may immediately flip this card after you Fail to Wound.

name: Tumble
rule: When you are about to suffer Crash, roll a d10. On a 6+ ignore it.

name: Unique
rule: There can be no more than one instance of a unique card in play or in the Argo Armory at any given time.

name: Vault
rule: If you’re adjacent to the Primordial, place your miniature on an empty space in a straight line from you, on the opposite side of the Primordial, adjacent to it. A Titan may use this ability in either the first or second ability window.

name: Forced Vault
rule: Same as Vault, but treat it as involuntary movement. If you would have to end this movement outside the Board Edge or on an Indestructible Obstacle Terrain tile, you die instead.

name: Wish Armor (X+)
rule: ?, no effect yet

name: Strangers
rule: No inherent effects.

name: Captives
rule: For each Captive you have, lose 1 Crew limit. You may lose 1 Captive when resolving a Spartan Stronghold (VIII.3.1.4) to ignore that resolution.

name: Combo
rule: A Primordial with the Combo Mechanic adds the following effects to the end of each AI card resolution: “If this is the first AI card resolved this round: Window of Opportunity. Combo”.

name: Resolving Combo
rule: When instructed to resolve Combo, resolve X.3.2.

name: Broken Combo
rule: If a Combo is broken (A.20), do not resolve the Combo.

name: Combo Track
rule: During setup, place a Combo token on this track, as instructed. Whenever a Combo is performed or broken (A.20), move the token to the next space on the track, clockwise.

name: Ignore Highest Rage
rule: While the Combo mechanic is in play, ignore X.5.2.

name: Crippled Titans
rule: For all purposes, when a Titan is Crippled, treat it as if it died (as if you no longer have it), except you do not remove it from the Argo. (Crippled Titans can be un-crippled with the Trauma Growth Technology card.)

name: Defectors
rule: Defectors are a resource. You may spend 1 Defector when rolling a Diplomacy Test to add +3 to the result. You cannot gain Defectors until you research the XXX Technology card.

name: Prisoners
rule: When you reveal a BP card with the “Prisoners!” flag, you may decide to voluntarily fail the attack before performing the Power Roll (X.5.7). If you do, resolve the Fail Response, as normal

name: Refugees
rule: For each Refugee you have, lose 1 Crew limit.

name: Spartan Dreamwalkers
rule: All Dreamwalker-class Titans acquired in Cycle 2 (even from campaign setup) come with the Spartan Dreamwalker strain Pattern card.

name: The Strong Eat
rule: In Battle against Primordials with this Trait, add 1 additional “You died.” Obol to the Obol deck.

name: Ignoring The Strong Eat
rule: If a Titan is  instructed to ignore this Trait, remove the added Obol card when that Titan is about to draw an Obol.

name: Backwards Momentum
rule: In Battles with the Backwards Momentum Trait, during setup, assign each Titan a pair of Time Anchors tokens of the same color. They keep one, and place the other as indicated on Battle Scenario diagrams.

name: Reestablish Time Anchor
rule: At the start of a Titan’s turn, it must reestablish its Time Anchor. To do so, move its Time Anchor to its current space. If a Titan is on a VP, place their Time Anchor adjacent to the Primordial instead.

name: Death by Fate
rule: Primordials with the Death by Fate Trait can deal Fate in addition to Danger with their Attacks. When a Titan is dealt Fate, still resolve VI.9.3, but use Fate instead of Danger and do not resolve the Armor Roll.

name: Death by Fate Trauma Draw
rule: When instructed to resolve a Trauma Draw with Death by Fate in play, select the higher of your Fate and Danger, then compare that to your Trauma Table.

name: Death by Fate Moiros Cards
rule: While Death by Fate is in play, gaining Fate over 9 does not cause you to draw a Moiros card.

name: Delphian Dreamwalkers
rule: All Dreamwalker-class Titans acquired in Cycle 3 (even from campaign setup) come with the Delphian Dreamwalker strain Pattern card.

name: Fragmented Landscape
rule: Not all sections of the Cycle 3 map are connected. If you travel to a tile that isn’t connected to the rest, set aside a new portion of the map. If you ever find the tiles that link them together, do so.

name: Map Symbol Time Wound
rule: Time Wounds can be moved through. To do so, set aside the map tile noted next to the Time Wound, then move the Argo to the Time Wound tile. When you do so, skip the Exploration and Expedition steps of that Campaign Day. During the next Campaign Day, you must move the Argo to the set aside tile. Adversaries treat Time Wound tiles as adjacent. Adversaries cannot move onto the Time Wound tile.

name: Time Portals
rule: If you have the required Technology, you can move through Time Portals. When you do, do not connect the tile you go to the tile you came from. Adversaries treat Time Portals as adjacent. Take Time Portals into account when considering the shortest path to the Argo during the Adversary Movement.

name: Paradox
rule: No inherent effect.
